2027 Dec - ATProto Science Workshop

Join us for an intensive workshop exploring the intersection of scholarly communication and decentralized protocols. This hands-on event will bring together researchers, developers, and tool builders to collaborate on the future of science on ATProto.

About This Workshop

The ATProto Science Workshop is a unique gathering designed to accelerate innovation in scholarly communication on decentralized protocols. Whether youâ€™re a researcher frustrated with traditional publishing, a developer building new tools, or simply curious about the future of science, this event is for you.

What to Expect

Over the course of this intensive workshop, participants will:

  • Explore New Paradigms: Discover how ATProto enables novel approaches to publishing, peer review, and scientific discourse
  • Hands-on Building: Collaborate on prototype tools and applications for research communities
  • Design Lexicons: Work together to design ATProto lexicons for scholarly activities like citations, annotations, and peer review
  • Network & Connect: Meet fellow researchers, independent scholars, and developers passionate about open science

Topics & Activities

The workshop will cover a range of themes:

  • Nanopublications and discourse graphs on ATProto
  • Building research feeds and discovery tools
  • AI applications for scientific work
  • Integrating tools for thought (Obsidian, Notion, Roam) with ATProto
  • Decentralized infrastructure for science data and services
  • Social apps designed specifically for research communities

Who Should Attend

This workshop welcomes a diverse community:

  • Academic researchers exploring alternatives to traditional publishing
  • Citizen scientists and independent scholars
  • Developers building ATProto applications
  • Tool builders working on knowledge management systems
  • Anyone interested in the intersection of science and decentralized protocols

Location & Date

Details on venue and specific dates will be announced soon. Stay tuned by following our Bluesky account or joining the ATProto Science Discourse forum.
